intro: Oxyanthus sankuruensis, commonly known as the Sankuru oxyanthus, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or wetland areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
